result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R. Whaley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
Assessment of Costs for Expert Laboratory Analysis and WItness Fees

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription & no alcohol in residence.   Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine as directed by agent.   Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.    
*  Pay fine of $1000  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Perform  150  hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  Pay Prosecution Costs of $86.00.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant, Jacob R. Whaley, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 90 days in the KCJ commencing on 9/10/16 at 8:00 AM. Huber & Work Crew is authorized.  He shall complete 150 hours of community service.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a $1000 fine plus costs and DE is also ordered to pay prosecution costs in the amount of $86.00.  All costs are to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jacob R. Whaley, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.   Clerk: PT
Atty Watson states she just received the PSI yesterday afternoon and hasn't had an opportunity to fully go over so she is requesting an adjournment; no objection by the State.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jacob R. Whaley, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In.  Count 2 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson appeared on behalf of Defendant, Jacob R. Whaley who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Watson requests an adjournment stating DE is currently in inpatient treatment at Gateway and provides documentation to the Court. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 09:50 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty Kristyne Watson appears on behalf of Defendant Jacob R. Whaley who is not in court.  Clerk: PT
Atty Watson has no explanation for DE's non appearance but states case is resolved and requests he be allowed to enter plea on monday in place of a trial.  Plea Hearing will be on May 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA E Trigg.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 4/28/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 5/2/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Atty Watson is unavailable for the FPT on 1/22/16.  Hearing reset for 3/3/16 at 9:20, to allow time for def. to view the videos.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Authorization for bench warrant and bond forfeiture are vacated; signature bond reinstated.  FPT 1/22/16 at 9:10.  Bond continued.
At request of Atty Watson, voluntary appearance scheduled for 12/11/15 at 9:40.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Atty Kristyne Watson appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not appear.  Case scheduled for 9:30 a.m.; case called at 10:30 a.m.  Def. had a court hearing in Waukegan this morning at 9:00 and thought this case was scheduled for 1:30 today.  Def. informed Atty Watson by phone that he was on his way to court at 9:20, but has not arrived.  Signature bond ordered forfeited.  Bench warrant to issue; bond set at $3,000.00 cash.  Orders stayed until 12/7/15 to allow Atty Watson time to contact def. and schedule a voluntary appearance.

Defendant, Jacob R. Whaley, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.

213 p.m. Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco.   Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Krystine Watson.  Clk:  Janell Thwing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Bond - Continued.

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(1)(h)1 - Man/Del THC 2 nd   - 2 Cts

2:02 pm    Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: NJ.  Deft will retain his own counsel.    Initial appearance adjourned to 9-30-15 @ 1:00pm w/Comm , 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  $1000 signature bond set with conditions.   /dls
and witness list filed by the State
